se.jguru.nazgul.core.jmx.api

Class AbstractMBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.management.StandardMBean
      • javax.management.StandardEmitterMBean
        • se.jguru.nazgul.core.jmx.api.AbstractMBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DynamicMBean, MBeanRegistration, NotificationBroadcaster, NotificationEmitter, LifecycleStateful
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractSuspendableMBean

    public abstract class AbstractMBean
extends StandardEmitterMBean
implements LifecycleStateful
    Abstract StandardEmitterMBean implementation adhering to the StandardLifecycle.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractMBean

        public AbstractMBean(Class<?> mbeanInterface,
                     NotificationEmitter delegate)

        Convenience constructor, creating a new AbstractMBean wrapping the supplied data. All NotificationEmitter operations executed in this AbstractMBean are delegated to the provided NotificationEmitter object. Thus, all JMX notifications fired by this AbstractMBean are simply delegated to the supplied NotificationEmitter.

        This constructor must be called from a subclass that implements the provided mbeanInterface.

        Parameters:
        mbeanInterface - a StandardMBean interface.
        delegate - A non-null NotificationEmitter to which this AbstractMBean will delegate all NotificationEmitter operations.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the mbeanInterface does not follow JMX design patterns for Management Interfaces, or if this does not implement the specified interface, or if delegate is null.
        See Also:
        StandardEmitterMBean.StandardEmitterMBean(Class, boolean, javax.management.NotificationEmitter)

      • AbstractMBean

        public AbstractMBean(Class<?> mbeanInterface,
                     boolean isMXBean,
                     NotificationEmitter delegate)

        Creates an AbstractMBean with the management interface mbeanInterface, and where notifications are handled by the given NotificationEmitter. This constructor can be used to make either Standard MBeans or MXBeans. The resultant MBean implements the NotificationEmitter interface by forwarding its methods to delegate.

        If delegate is an instance of NotificationBroadcasterSupport then the MBean's sendNotification method will delegate its invocation to delegate. NotificationBroadcasterSupport.sendNotification(Notification).

        The array returned by StandardEmitterMBean.getNotificationInfo() on the new MBean is a copy of the array returned by emitter.NotificationBroadcaster.getNotificationInfo() at the time of construction. If the array returned by emitter.getNotificationInfo() later changes, that will have no effect on this object's getNotificationInfo().

        This constructor must be called from a subclass that implements the given mbeanInterface.

        Parameters:
        mbeanInterface - a StandardMBean interface.
        isMXBean - If true, the mbeanInterface parameter names an MXBean interface and the resultant MBean is an MXBean.
        delegate - A non-null NotificationEmitter to which this AbstractMBean will delegate all NotificationEmitter operations.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the mbeanInterface does not follow JMX design patterns for Management Interfaces, or if this does not implement the specified interface, or if delegate is null.

    • Method Detail

      • getState

        public final LifecycleState getState()
        The current state of this MXBean.
        Specified by:
        getState in interface LifecycleStateful
        Returns:
        The current state of this MXBean. This value must never be null.

      • preRegister

        public final ObjectName preRegister(MBeanServer server,
                                    ObjectName name)
                             throws Exception
        Standard implementation of the MBeanRegistration lifecycle method, delegating execution to (in order):
        1. customPreregister(), where subclasses may manipulate the JMX ObjectName.
        2. super.preRegister(), performing the actual registration of this AbstractMBean in the MBeanServer.
        Specified by:
        preRegister in interface MBeanRegistration
        Overrides:
        preRegister in class StandardMBean
        Throws:
        Exception
        See Also:
        customPreregister(javax.management.MBeanServer, javax.management.ObjectName)

      • customPreregister

        protected ObjectName customPreregister(MBeanServer server,
                                       ObjectName objectName)
        Override this method to perform customization of the ObjectName under which this AbstractMBean should be registered within the supplied MBeanServer. Note! This method is invoked from within the preRegister method, implying that this method may not register this AbstractMBean in the MBean server.
        Parameters:
        server - The MBeanServer instance.
        objectName - The object name of the MBean, which is null if the name parameter to one of the createMBean or registerMBean methods in the MBeanServer interface is null. In that case, this method must return a non-null ObjectName for the new MBean.
        Returns:
        A non-null ObjectName under which this AbstractMBean will be registered in the MBeanServer.

      • customPostregister

        protected void customPostregister()
        Override this method to perform any customized actions after this AbstractMBean has been successfully registered in the MBeanServer. This method will only be invoked if the registration in the MBeanServer was successful (i.e. if the registrationDone parameter received by the postRegister method was true. This method should not throw Exceptions.
        See Also:
        postRegister(Boolean)

      • customPreDeregister

        protected void customPreDeregister()
        Override this method to perform any customized actions before this AbstractMBean will be de-registered in the MBeanServer. This method will be invoked immediately before the super.preDeregister() method is called - but only if this AbstractMBean is not in LifecycleState.ERROR state. (The customPostDeregister() method is always called, irrespective of state).

      • customPostDeregister

        protected void customPostDeregister()
        Override this mthod to perform any customized actions before this AbstractMBean will be de-registered in the MBeanServer. This method will be invoked immediately before the super.preDeregister() method is called. This method should not throw Exceptions.

      • sendAttributeChangeEvent

        protected final <T> void sendAttributeChangeEvent(String attributeName,
                                                  String eventMessage,
                                                  Class<T> objectType,
                                                  T oldValue,
                                                  T newValue)
        Helper method which creates a JMX AttributeChangeNotification instance from the supplied data, and notifies all registered NotificationListener instances by invoking sendNotification() with the newly constructed AttributeChangeNotification as an argument.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The attribute Class.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - The name of the attribute which changed, such as "state". Cannot be null or empty.
        eventMessage - A human-readable AttributeChangeNotification eventMessage, such as "LifecycleState changed". Cannot be null or empty.
        objectType - The attribute Class. Cannot be null.
        oldValue - The value before the change.
        newValue - The value after the change.

      • performStateTransition

        protected final boolean performStateTransition(boolean validateFromState,
                                               LifecycleState from,
                                               LifecycleState to)
        Performs a state transition in this AbstractMBean which may be validated (in the sense that the from state must match the result from getState() to permit the state transition). If the stat transition was actually made, an AttributeChangeNotification is sent by this AbstractMBean to permit any state listeners to react to the event.
        Parameters:
        validateFromState - if true, the result of getState() must be equal to from to permit the state transition. Otherwise, the state transition will not be performed.
        from - The expected state of this AbstractMBean.
        to - The state to transition to.
        Returns:
        true if the transition was successfully made, and false otherwise.

      • getStateTransitionFilter

        public static AttributeChangeNotificationFilter getStateTransitionFilter()
        Returns:
        An AttributeChangeNotificationFilter which will listen only to state change events emitted by an AbstractMBean subclass (e.g. AttributeChangeEvent with attributeName set to the value of constant STATE_CHANGE_ATTRIBUTENAME).
